title: HVAC Audit and Analysis | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Learn HVAC operations, measurement, data acquisition, and analytics to determine SEC of chilled water and air handling systems.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Learn HVAC operations, measurement, data acquisition, and analytics to determine SEC of chilled water and air handling systems.
Chiller plants are an essential part of buildings and consume a significant amount of energy.

This course focuses on the fundamental operations of HVAC components (comprising chilled water and air handling systems), measurement, data acquisition, and analytics to determine the specific energy consumption (SEC) of the chilled water and air handling systems. During the course, participants will be tasked to measure and analyse at least 2 weeks of HVAC components raw data, propose potential energy-saving opportunities, and design improvement concepts through the group presentation. Assessment will be in the form of MCQ and group presentation.
Engineers and managers who are required to understand piping network in the following industries:
Process industries such as chemicals and energy, pharmaceutical engineering, food manufacturing
Bachelor degree in engineering or engineering diploma with 2 years of relevant working experience
Compression cycle and compression chiller systems
Absorption cycle and absorption chiller systems
Analysing the performance of a chiller plant and chiller sequencing
Fundamental of chiller plants and its associated components
Fundamental of cooling towers and its operation
Performance calculation of HVAC system (air side)
Introduction to fans/blower for air distribution
Fan selection and pressure drop: Major loss, minor loss, relationship between volume flow rates, pressure drop and power
Critical parameters for air side performance
Fundamental of cooling towers and its operation
Data acquisition methodology on HVAC parameters for analysis
Key parameters on HVAC facilities that affect energy performance
Efficiency index for different facilities and their best practice efficiencies
Safety requirement on power measurement and other measurements
AHU airflow/face velocity/on/off coil temp using psychrometric chart and software
Cooling measurement methods on chilled water system + heat balance
Tutorial on identification of measuring location and type of tools needed
Financial analysis of operating HVAC system
Net Present Value (NPV) and Internal Rate of Return (IRR)
Super-imposed plot generation: Power, flowrate, temp, pressure, tonnage, efficiency
Histogram generation: Power, temp, tonnage, efficiency
Scatter diagram for correlation observation: Tonnage vs efficiency, flowrate vs pressure, flowrate per cooling capacity vs delta temp
Solution proposal with financial calculation (case study)
Vice President, Business and Operation of G-Energy Global Pte Ltd
Vice President, Business and Operation of G-Energy Global Pte Ltd

An accredited Key Qualified Person, Singapore Certified Energy Manager (Professional Level) and Certified Green Mark Professional to assist companies to apply for NEA grant on energy audit program and BCA Green Mark Incentive Scheme. Joseph also has been lecturing Specialist Diploma in Energy Efficiency and Management Course in Singapore Polytechnic and Sustainable Energy Association of Singapore since 2003 till now. He is also a registered trainer to conduct Singapore Certified Energy Manager, Diploma in Facilities & Energy Management and Green Mark Manager/Professional Course and Energy Audit and Management at the University of SIM. Lately he represented Singapore to complete Asian Energy Management Scheme Country Expert program and in the process of developing training program to assist organizations in improving their internal energy management practices. Currently, he is also appointed as Green Mark Energy Modelling External Assessor and Examiner for Green Mark Manager/Professional Course.

As an Energy Consultant practicing actively since 2002, Joseph has led and facilitated energy conservation projects in multiple scopes with numerous companies. In 2005, Green Mark Singapore was launched as an initiative to promote sustainability in the built environment and raise environmental awareness among developers, designers and builders. Coupled with his strong desire and passion to see greater green dynamics and synergy within our building environment in Singapore, G-Energy Global was founded.

Abid Ali is an energy specialist at the Energy Efficiency Technology Centre (EETC), Singapore Institute of Technology. He is a Certified ASEAN Energy Manager Trainer (AJEEP-ToT) and a Singapore Certified Energy Manager (SCEM-Professional). With experience spanning over a decade in energy auditing, green building practices, and sustainability-related standards, Abid has assessed numerous buildings and facilities. He has conducted comprehensive (ASHRAE-level 3) energy audits for both commercial and industrial facilities, focusing on key areas such as chilled water systems, air distribution, mechanical ventilation, and compressed air systems. He has worked with various government agencies in Singapore to assist companies in accessing government grants, thus making their transition to greener technologies more economically feasible. Within EETC, Abid led benchmarking studies for energy and water usage in the urban farming sector in Singapore. He also contributed to the development of some Singapore standards within his field of expertise.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
